title: Accelerate the Pipeline: Research-to-Product Consolidation
summary: Merged Google Brain and DeepMind into unified 5,600-person organization, launched Tim Brooks' world-modeling team, accelerating research-to-product pipeline.

content.whatItIs: Google consolidated its AI research organizations (Google Brain and DeepMind) into a unified Google DeepMind organization, growing from ~2,500 to 5,600 employees. The merged entity launched new initiatives including Tim Brooks' world-modeling team, with explicit mandate to accelerate research-to-product pipeline.
howItWorks: Merged Google Brain and DeepMind into single organization
Grew from ~2,500 to 5,600 employees through consolidation and hiring
Launched specialized teams like Tim Brooks' world-modeling research
Explicit mandate to accelerate research-to-product pipeline
Unified leadership under Demis Hassabis to eliminate coordination friction
content.coreInsight: Having two separate elite AI research organizations created coordination overhead and slower research-to-product transfer. Consolidation under unified leadership enables faster deployment of research breakthroughs into Google products.
content.keyMetrics: 2,500 to 5,600 employees; unified organization; Tim Brooks world-modeling team launched
